input: Bob is big. Bob is blue. Bob is green. Bob is round. Bob is smart. Bob is young. Charlie is green. Charlie is not nice. Charlie is not young. Erin is blue. Harry is young. If Erin is blue and Erin is young then Erin is smart. If someone is round then they are young. All blue people are green. If Harry is blue then Harry is big. If Charlie is green and Charlie is young then Charlie is nice. Big people are round. All round, green people are big. All blue, green people are big. Question: Erin is not smart.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Big Bob
axiom T2 : Blue Bob
axiom T3 : Green Bob
axiom T4 : Round Bob
axiom T5 : Smart Bob
axiom T6 : Young Bob
axiom T7 : Green Charlie
axiom T8 : ¬ Nice Charlie
axiom T9 : ¬ Young Charlie
axiom T10 : Blue Erin
axiom T11 : Young Harry

axiom R1 : Blue Erin ∧ Young Erin → Smart Erin
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Round x → Young x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Green x
axiom R4 : Harry = Blue → Big Harry
axiom R5 : Green Charlie ∧ Young Charlie → Nice Charlie
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Round x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Round x ∧ Green x → Big x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x ∧ Green x → Big x

theorem erin_is_not_smart : ¬ Smart Erin :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Erin is smart

theorem erin_is_smart : Smart Erin :=
begin
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T10,
  apply R2,
  apply R6,
  apply R8,
  split,
  exact T10,
  apply R3,
  exact T10,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
